instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: missing component. imac 2015 820-00431-002.
threads.message:
I have a motherboard (820-00431-002)  that has a missing resistor. I would like to know the value of that resistance. I can't find that information anywhere. The resistor is connected to the ISL6372 pin 6 chip.
I'm going to post the photo of the board with the missing resistor.
Can someone help me please?

threads.title: missing component. imac 2015 820-00431-002.
threads.message:
No schematic/boardview for this board.
820-00034 may be the closest available.
Unfortunately, CPU power supply is not built with ISL6372 in this case.

820-3478 uses ISL6372.
In this case, there is 2.67K resistor connected; 2.5-3K should be not a problem to use.
